comments.body: Assuming you have staked your bitcoin address or you have anyone like the one you are using now and you will keep its seed phrase or private key in order to be able to sign a message with it at anytime. Also be tracking the exchange address and make sure the exchange gas has not changed it to a new address which can be another disappointment.Also that you know the risks of not your key not your coin. So if you want to be converting your bitcoin to naira and spend it, there is nothing bad.But if you want to hold, it is better you continue with your noncustodial wallet.

comments.body: A lot of Bitcoin forks have approached me seeking this advice before,Â  but to be honest with you,Â  if you want to use an exchange wallet to receive your Bitcoin then it should be taken as a temporary option and not for long-term usage because exchange wallets aside from it many other disadvantages,Â  the wallet are changed at regular intervals. So for that to be on the safer side,Â  if the payment is a one-time payment and forum then you can use the exchange wallet to receive the payments,Â  but if you are planning for long-term usage,Â  then be ready to lose your Bitcoin at some point when your wallet get expired by the exchange,Â  so this is what to consider before you accept to use exchange wallets.
